entry.title: moderncv with GitHub and Linkedin logos
entry.content:
The moderncv $\rm \LaTeX$ package provides a documentclass for typesetting curriculum vitaes in various formats and styles. With few, very defined commands, you can make a highly professional CV.

Many examples and templates are available out there, as the examples folder on CTAN webpage. From there, it can be seen that some commands are used to define the user's personal information, such as the home address (\address), email (\email), and homepage (\homepage). However, in many cases, it is also important to point out other resources such as your GitHub account and your Linkedin page.

In order to add such information in moderncv, I made some modifications in the source code, and found the logos in this tex.stackexchange thread. Now you can add your GitHub account and Linkedin page with \github and \linkedin commands from inside your tex file. The result should be something like this

To use this commands you will have to download the modified files from this GitHub repository, put them in a folder and compile in the usual way. Make sure your source tex file is within this folder. In that repository there are template files to get you started (source here and pdf here).

You can download a zipped file with all you need from here, or you can clone it with git

bash git clone git@github.com:fernandomayer/moderncv.git

For Brazilian users of moderncv I also made the \lattes command, so you can add the link for your full "Curr√≠culo Lattes" CV, with the CNPq logo. This would look like this
